Exaggerate: The claim that Vice President Mike Pence was arrested on Jan. 6 is an exaggeration as it contradicts the fact that Pence was moved to a secure location and returned to the Senate chamber later that day.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there are no credible reports or evidence provided to back up the assertion that Pence was arrested.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that Pence was arrested without any substantiating evidence or confirmation.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that Pence was not arrested but was instead evacuated to a secure location for his safety during the Capitol riots.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Pence was not arrested but was safely relocated during the Capitol riots.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times as it ignores the verified information and events surrounding Pence's presence and actions during the Capitol riots.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in this claim, as it is an exaggeration rather than an understatement.
